intro: Melpomene xiphopteroides, commonly known as the flame flower, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular red or orange flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial with upright stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are highly attractive to birds and insects, making it a popular ornamental plant. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth.
